body_html:
We know pip 1.5.4 works because that's what comes with Ubuntu 14.04. Is there anything in the pip release notes that you think might have caused this issue?

Also I'm not even sure if it's possible for us to tune our setup.py to throw an error if a particular version of pip is being used. pip seems independent of the setuptools process.
body_text:
We know pip 1.5.4 works because that's what comes with Ubuntu 14.04. Is there anything in the pip release notes that you think might have caused this issue?

Also I'm not even sure if it's possible for us to tune our setup.py to throw an error if a particular version of pip is being used. pip seems independent of the setuptools process.
body:
We know pip 1.5.4 works because that's what comes with Ubuntu 14.04. Is there anything in the [pip release notes](https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/news/) that you think might have caused this issue?

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/49262/19413056/375c65f4-92d8-11e6-8c27-5dbd457ec3ef.png)

Also I'm not even sure if it's possible for us to tune our setup.py to throw an error if a particular version of pip is being used. pip seems independent of the setuptools process.
